Weather Briefing

Documentation

Forecast Models¶

A variety of model forecast websites. Note that only a few of these websites focus on Canada, it is often a necessary compromise to use a broad domain to forecast for Canada.

MSc Animet¶

Animet

A huge amount of model output from Environment and Climate Change Canada. Can select any Candian model and a near infinite choise of output and variables. Zoomable interface over all of Canada, can save image and gifs as needed. Animet also includes a huge selection of MSc observations including radar and satellite.

Windy¶

Windy

One of the more unique forecast pages. A variety of weather variables that can be adjusted for height. Users can also add plugins, the most useful of which is the is the MeteoBlue plugin. These are some of the best meteograms available.

Tropical Tidbits¶

Forecast Models

Southern US focued weather page. Focused information on the Atlantic Basin hurricanes. Really good satellite imagery for the tropics. Additionally, a wide range of models including deterministic and probabilisitic models. Additionally can look at short term seasonal forecast on a national scale. The only good zoom over Canada is nationwide.

Pivotal Weather¶

Pivotal

A wide range of model output for a variety of application. Pivotal has create resources for convective forecasting and winter weather.

Spot Wx¶

Spot

Great website to get timeseries from numerous global forecast models. The website shows the locations and size of the gridcell being grabbed from each location.

Climate Prediction Center Madden Julian Oscillation Forecast¶

CPC MJO

Model viewer for the forecast MJO index which goes out ~2 weeks.

UBC WFRT Vancouver Forecast¶

WFRT

The best meteorgram for Vancouver that there is.

BlueSky - Smoke¶

FireSmoke

Access surface smoke modeling as well as an FWI forecast. Additionally, BlueSky Playground is available to run different emissions scenarios for prescribed fires.

North American Pollution Center¶

NA RVFSP-WAC

Multi-model viewer for PM2.5 and other smoke related variables. Also a link for CWFIS fire weather maps and subseasonal outlook maps.

National Forest Service Hot Dry Windy¶

HWD

Canada/USA Hot Dry Windy index map. Can pull timeseries of the HDW index including climatological means. Links to prominent HDW publications and how to interpret the index.

Windgrams¶

RASP Windgrams

Using Canadian data to create a visual meteogram for different locations in western Canada. Looks specifically at surface pressure, total cloud, and atmospheric stability. Gives a great look at how stability changes diurnally under different weather patters. Only produces at certain locations in western Canada.

Seasonal Forecasting¶

National Multimodel Ensemble¶

NMME Monthly

Monthly means of precipitation and 2m temperature anomalies from the North American Multi-Model Ensemble. Produced by the Climate Prediction Center.

International Multimodel Ensemble¶

IMME

Monthly means of precipitation and 2m temperature anomalies from the International Multi-Model Ensemble. Produced by the Climate Prediction Center.

CanSIPS Canada Seasonal Forecast¶

CanSIPS

CanSIPS model output all of Canada. Focus is places on precipitation anomalies and 2m temperature. This site includes recent verification statistics.

World Meteorological Society Sub-Seasonal Forecast¶

WMO Weekly Outlooks

Plot a variety of models subseasonal forecast. User can select a desired subset of models for temperature, precipitation, and sea level pressure, 500hPa heights, and 850hPa temperature.
